intro: Neea popenoei, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. Neea popenoei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
